scenarioDescription:
The HIP 114933 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HIP 114933 is a star with 1.39 times the mass of the Sun, and 5.27 times its radius. It is located 331.92 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.4 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HIP 114933 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HIP 114933 system


HIP 114933 b

HIP 114933 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2021-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.84 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HIP 114933 b is 616.920 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HIP 114933 b is 13.400 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HIP 114933 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HIP 114933, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: HIP 114933 - System With 1 Exoplanet
